tool_description: Your go-to AI for dynamic and diverse quotes from various categories -  inspiration, motivation, wisdom, and more. Easily filter by author, category, or ID. Elevate your applications with this versatile and cool resource.
name: Get Quotes API
title: Get Quotes API

api_list.name: Get Quote by Id
api_list.description:
Retrieve details of a specific quote using its unique identifier.

Example: The below endpoint returns the quote with id 1
https://api-get-quotes.vercel.app/api/v1/id/1

api_list.name: Get Quotes by Author
api_list.description:
Retrieve quotes attributed to a specific author by providing their name.

Example - get quotes by Steve Jobs: 

https://api-get-quotes.vercel.app/api/v1/author/Steve%20Jobs

api_list.name: Get Quotes by Category
api_list.description:
Retrieve quotes based on a specific category. 

Choose from available categories: Motivation, Life, Wisdom, Love, Technology, Creativity, Courage, Nature, Change, Inspiration, Leadership, Happiness, Perseverance, Imagination, Hope, Friendship..

api_list.name: Get Random Quote
api_list.description:
Obtain a randomly selected quote from the collection.
Endpoint returns a random quote object from the array of quotes.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://get-quotes-api.p.rapidapi.com/random"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "get-quotes-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

url = "https://get-quotes-api.p.rapidapi.com/random"

headers = {

print(response.json())

api_list.name: Get All Quotes
api_list.description: This endpoint returns list of all quotes from all categories & authors with each quote object having the data: id, category, quote, description & author.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://get-quotes-api.p.rapidapi.com/quotes"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "get-quotes-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
